<ce:section-title>Synthesis of complexes <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>–<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>
</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">
<ce:italic>[Mn(L)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(CH<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>CN)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>](ClO<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(CH<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>CN)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>
</ce:italic> (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>). A solution of L (22 mg, 0.1 mmol) in CH<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>CN (15 ml) was added to an aqueous solution (10 ml) of Mn(ClO<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (36 mg, 0.1 mmol). After ca. 30 min of vigorous mixing, the solution was filtered and left to stand at room temperature. Light-yellow prismatic single crystals suitable for X-ray analysis were obtained by evaporation of the solvent within 1 week. Yield: 65%. Found: C, 42.4; H, 3.8; N, 18.3%. Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">32</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">32</ce:inf>Cl<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>MnN<ce:inf loc="post">12</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">12</ce:inf>: C, 42.6; H, 3.6; N, 18.6%. FT-IR (KBr pellet, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3455b, 3067s, 2220m, 1662m, 1616m, 1570m, 1489m, 1423s, 1283m, 1219m, 1108vs, 1063s, 1008m, 842m, 723s, 626m, 504m.</ce:para><ce:para view="all">
<ce:italic>[Fe(L)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(NSC)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>]</ce:italic> (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>). A solution of an excess of NH<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>SCN (24 mg, 0.3 mmol) in H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (10 ml) was added to a CH<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>CN/CHCl<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> solution (15 ml) containing FeCl<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·4H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (20 mg, 0.1 mmol) and L (44 mg, 0.2 mmol) in 1:2 molar ratio. After ca. 30 min of vigorous mixing under refluxing, the reaction mixture was filtered and left to stand at room temperature. Yellow block single crystals suitable for X-ray analysis were obtained by slow evaporation of the solvent within 2 weeks. Yield: 70%. Found: C, 47.9; H, 3.2; N, 20.9%. Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">26</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">20</ce:inf>FeN<ce:inf loc="post">10</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>S<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>: C, 47.6; H, 3.1; N, 21.3%. FT-IR (KBr pellet, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3355b, 3088w, 3038w, 2077vs, 1955w, 1613s, 1566s, 1541s, 1486s, 1422s, 1370w, 1335m, 1322w, 1275m, 1230w, 1218s, 1124m, 1107w, 1064s, 1006s, 966m, 840s, 744s, 723vs, 710s, 695s.</ce:para><ce:para view="all">
<ce:italic>[Ag<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(L)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>](BF<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(CH<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>OH)<ce:inf loc="post">0.5</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">0.5</ce:inf>
</ce:italic> (<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>). A solution of AgBF<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf> (19 mg, 0.1 mmol) in CH<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>OH (10 ml) was carefully layered on top of a CHCl<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> solution (10 ml) of L (22 mg, 0.1 mmol) in a test-tube. After ca. 2 weeks at room temperature, colorless single crystals appeared at the boundary between CH<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>OH and CHCl<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>. Yield: 50%. Found: C, 33.7; H, 2.6; N, 13.3%. Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">24.5</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">19</ce:inf>Ag<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>B<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>F<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>: C, 34.1; H, 2.2; N, 13.0%. FT-IR (KBr pellet, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3440b, 3104m, 3062w, 1619s, 1567s, 1542s, 1488s, 1429s, 1341w, 1285m, 1224m, 1073vs, 1022vs, 971m, 845s, 747s, 731s, 716s, 705m, 551w, 521m, 506w, 411w.</ce:para>
clean_text:
Synthesis of complexes 1-3 

 [Mn(L)2(H2O)2(CH3CN)2](ClO4)2(CH3CN)2  (1). A solution of L (22 mg, 0.1 mmol) in CH3CN (15 ml) was added to an aqueous solution (10 ml) of Mn(ClO4)2⋅6H2O (36 mg, 0.1 mmol). After ca. 30 min of vigorous mixing, the solution was filtered and left to stand at room temperature. Light-yellow prismatic single crystals suitable for X-ray analysis were obtained by evaporation of the solvent within 1 week. Yield: 65%. Found: C, 42.4; H, 3.8; N, 18.3%. Calc. for C32H32Cl2MnN12O12: C, 42.6; H, 3.6; N, 18.6%. FT-IR (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3455b, 3067s, 2220m, 1662m, 1616m, 1570m, 1489m, 1423s, 1283m, 1219m, 1108vs, 1063s, 1008m, 842m, 723s, 626m, 504m.

 [Fe(L)2(NSC)2(H2O)2] (2). A solution of an excess of NH4SCN (24 mg, 0.3 mmol) in H2O (10 ml) was added to a CH3CN/CHCl3 solution (15 ml) containing FeCl2⋅4H2O (20 mg, 0.1 mmol) and L (44 mg, 0.2 mmol) in 1:2 molar ratio. After ca. 30 min of vigorous mixing under refluxing, the reaction mixture was filtered and left to stand at room temperature. Yellow block single crystals suitable for X-ray analysis were obtained by slow evaporation of the solvent within 2 weeks. Yield: 70%. Found: C, 47.9; H, 3.2; N, 20.9%. Calc. for C26H20FeN10O4S2: C, 47.6; H, 3.1; N, 21.3%. FT-IR (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3355b, 3088w, 3038w, 2077vs, 1955w, 1613s, 1566s, 1541s, 1486s, 1422s, 1370w, 1335m, 1322w, 1275m, 1230w, 1218s, 1124m, 1107w, 1064s, 1006s, 966m, 840s, 744s, 723vs, 710s, 695s.

 [Ag2(L)2](BF4)2(CH3OH)0.5(H2O)0.5  (3). A solution of AgBF4 (19 mg, 0.1 mmol) in CH3OH (10 ml) was carefully layered on top of a CHCl3 solution (10 ml) of L (22 mg, 0.1 mmol) in a test-tube. After ca. 2 weeks at room temperature, colorless single crystals appeared at the boundary between CH3OH and CHCl3. Yield: 50%. Found: C, 33.7; H, 2.6; N, 13.3%. Calc. for C24.5H19Ag2B2F8N8O3: C, 34.1; H, 2.2; N, 13.0%. FT-IR (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3440b, 3104m, 3062w, 1619s, 1567s, 1542s, 1488s, 1429s, 1341w, 1285m, 1224m, 1073vs, 1022vs, 971m, 845s, 747s, 731s, 716s, 705m, 551w, 521m, 506w, 411w.
